title: UX-designer till uppdrag med fokus på komplexa system
description:
Vi söker nu en erfaren och engagerad UX-designer för vår kunds räkning. Du har förmågan att snabbt sätta dig in i projektets omfattning, användare och användningsfall, och spelar en nyckelroll i att identifiera och hantera utmaningar tidigt i processen. Målet är att säkerställa att projektet kan skalas upp utan hinder.

#### **Ansvarsområden:**

* Förstå och definiera projektets omfattning, målgrupp och användningsfall.
* Identifiera och adressera utmaningar kopplade till användningsfall för att undvika hinder längre fram i projektet.
* Planera och strukturera design- och forskningsarbete för en effektiv arbetsprocess.
* Hantera komplexa system som innefattar både hård- och mjukvarukomponenter.

#### **Kvalifikationer:**

* **Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom UX-design**, gärna med fokus på hårdvarunära projekt.
* Stark förmåga att analysera och hantera komplexa system med både hård- och mjukvaruelement.
* Proaktiv problemlösare med förmåga att förutse och hantera potentiella utmaningar.
* God kommunikationsförmåga, särskilt när det gäller att förklara teknisk information på ett begripligt sätt.
* Självständig och effektiv i ett högt arbetstempo.

**Det här är ett konsultuppdrag, med start omgående**

 *Urval sker löpande, vänta inte med din ansökan!*

title: Krav- och verksamhetsanalytiker till E-hälsomyndigheten
description:
Är du en it-nära krav- och verksamhetsanalytiker som trivs i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och it? Drivs du av att göra nytta och påverka samhället på riktigt? Då kan det här vara en roll för dig.
  
  

Om tjänsten
  
  

I rollen som krav- och verksamhetsanalytiker hos oss arbetar du i ett tvärfunktionellt agilt team där du tillsammans med systemutvecklare, ux-specialister, utredare och andra verksamhetsspecialister löpande levererar värde. Ditt ansvar innebär att utreda och dokumentera verksamhetens krav i en tydlig struktur, både på övergripande och detaljerad nivå. Kraven omvandlas sedan till lösningsförslag och utvecklingsuppgifter tillsammans med teamets övriga roller. Du fungerar även som ett stöd när det kommer till prioritering och analysarbete kopplat till området.
  
  

Du arbetar nära dina kollegor och ni ansvarar gemensamt i teamet för kvaliteten på arbetet. Du fungerar som länken mellan användarnas behov och de tekniska möjligheterna, vilket innebär att du har många olika kontaktytor på jobbet. Ni driver utveckling tillsammans för att skapa våra framtida digitala hälsodatalösningar och du är med och skapar nytta för Sveriges medborgare. Teamet befinner sig tekniskt i framkant och du får ta stort eget ansvar samtidigt som du är med och bidrar till helheten.
  
  

Om dig
  
  

Du är en person som brinner för tekniken och rör dig obehindrat mellan verktyg och miljöer. Du är samarbetsinriktad och har lätt för att bygga relationer i hela organisationen. Det är en självklarhet för dig att ta ansvar för ditt eget arbete och du arbetar både strukturerat och noggrant. Vidare har du en flexibel inställning i din yrkesroll och du ser till helheten i såväl stort som smått.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

relevant akademisk utbildning alternativt likvärdig arbetslivserfarenhet
  
minst tre års aktuell erfarenhet av kravarbete i it-nära verksamhet
  
erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt
  
goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**  

erfarenhet av arbete inom vård-, hälso- och/eller omsorgssektorn
  
erfarenhet av arbete på myndighet.
  
Vad erbjuder vi?
  
  

Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
  
  

Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
  
  

På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
  
  

Är du intresserad?
  
  

Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av enhetschef Ileana Voicu, 010-106 0742 eller enhetschef Ulrika Engebladh, 010-458 6261.
  
  

Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av hr-specialist Dorothea Lockman, 010-175 3741.
  
  

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 27 oktober. Ladda gärna upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan.
  
  

Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är Kalmar eller Stockholm. Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan Kalmar och Stockholm.
  
  

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Därför kan vi komma att behöva genomföra en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För en del arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
  
  

Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den hr-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
  
  

Om E-hälsomyndigheten
  
  

E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
  
  

Hos oss arbetar cirka 600 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
  
  

Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens hr-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

Du arbetar nära dina kollegor och ni ansvarar gemensamt i teamet för kvaliteten på arbetet. Du fungerar som länken mellan användarnas behov och de tekniska möjligheterna, vilket innebär att du har många olika kontaktytor på jobbet. Ni driver utveckling tillsammans för att skapa våra framtida digitala hälsodatalösningar och du är med och skapar nytta för Sveriges medborgare. Teamet befinner sig tekniskt i framkant och du får ta stort eget ansvar samtidigt som du är med och bidrar till helheten.
  
  

Om dig
  
Du är en person som brinner för tekniken och rör dig obehindrat mellan verktyg och miljöer. Du är samarbetsinriktad och har lätt för att bygga relationer i hela organisationen. Det är en självklarhet för dig att ta ansvar för ditt eget arbete och du arbetar både strukturerat och noggrant. Vidare har du en flexibel inställning i din yrkesroll och du ser till helheten i såväl stort som smått.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

* relevant akademisk utbildning alternativt likvärdig arbetslivserfarenhet
* minst tre års aktuell erfarenhet av kravarbete i it-nära verksamhet
* erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt
* goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.


**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**  

* erfarenhet av arbete inom vård-, hälso- och/eller omsorgssektorn
* erfarenhet av arbete på myndighet.


Vad erbjuder vi?
  
Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
  
  

Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
  
  

På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
  
  

Är du intresserad?
  
Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av enhetschef Ileana Voicu, 010-106 0742 eller enhetschef Ulrika Engebladh, 010-458 6261.
  
  

Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av hr-specialist Dorothea Lockman, 010-175 3741.
  
  

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 27 oktober. Ladda gärna upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan.
  
  

Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är Kalmar eller Stockholm. Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan Kalmar och Stockholm.
  
  

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Därför kan vi komma att behöva genomföra en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För en del arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
  
  

Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den hr-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
  
  

Om E-hälsomyndigheten
  
E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
  
  

Hos oss arbetar cirka 600 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
  
  

Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens hr-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: Digital Affärschef Optimera
description:
Malmö Optimera Svenska AB Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-07  

Vill du arbeta i en relationsdriven bransch som andas personlig service, försäljning och framåtanda? Vår vision är att vara den ledande möjliggöraren av hållbart byggande i Sverige. Vi tar ansvar för våra medarbetare, kunder och vår planet, vill du vara med och göra skillnad?
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens bygghandel? Optimera söker nu en affärsdriven och strategisk **Digital Affärschef** som vill ta ledningen i vår digitala utveckling och skapa kundupplevelser i världsklass!



Som Digital Affärschef har du det övergripande ansvaret för att utveckla och driva Optimeras digitala affärer med fokus på e-handel, app och digitala kundupplevelser. Rollen är både strategisk och operativ – du arbetar datadrivet, sätter mål, följer upp resultat och identifierar nya affärsmöjligheter som stärker vårt erbjudande.



Du rapporterar till Marketing Director och samarbetar nära både centrala funktioner och lokala enheter för att säkerställa en sömlös kundresa mellan fysiska och digitala kanaler.


**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**


* Utveckla och driva e-handeln med fokus på försäljning, sortiment, kundupplevelse och konvertering
* Leda och vidareutveckla Optimeras app som en central kanal för lojalitet, service och försäljning
* Analysera kundbeteenden och affärsdata för att skapa insikter och fatta datadrivna beslut
* Identifiera nya digitala affärsmöjligheter och partnerskap
* Säkerställa en integrerad kundresa mellan fysiska och digitala kanaler
* Sätta mål, följa upp resultat och rapportera till Marketing Director


**Varför arbeta hos oss?**



Vårt mål är att bli branschens bästa arbetsgivare! Hos oss arbetar en fantastisk laguppställning av duktiga, engagerade medarbetare med servicekänsla ut i fingerspetsarna. Vi vet att en positiv arbetsplats där alla kan vara sig själva, utvecklas och trivas är A och O för vår framgång och för att våra kunder ska välja oss! Att jobba inom Optimera Svenska AB innebär variation och en möjlighet att vara en del av det stora bolagets trygghet samtidigt som du upplever entreprenörsandan av det lilla bolaget. Vi har ambitiösa hållbarhetsmål där alla är med och gör skillnad. Säkerhet är vår högsta prioritet och vi arbetar tillsammans varje dag för en bra arbetsmiljö.



Vi erbjuder bland annat kollektivavtal, friskvård, unika personalrabatter och möjlighet till fördelaktigt aktiesparande. För oss är det viktigt med hållbara medarbetare samt att ge våra medarbetare möjlighet att växa och utvecklas inom företaget.


**Dina kvalifikationer**


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av chefsroller inom digital affärsutveckling och försäljning
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom digital affärsutveckling och gärna försäljning B2B
* Gedigen erfarenhet av e-handel, appar eller andra digitala säljkanaler
* Van att kravställa mot IT och arbeta med många intressenter i flera parallella projekt
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta datadrivet och kommersiellt
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt med medarbetare inom alla delar av en organisation såsom exempelvis IT och sälj
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i matrisorganisation
* God förståelse för hur digitala system som CRM, PIM och ERP påverkar affären, och förmåga att samverka med IT kring systemlösningar
* Relevant akademisk examen


**Meriterande erfarenheter:**


* Erfarenhet från B2B-verksamhet, grossist eller byggsektorn
* Förståelse för CRO, UX och digital marknadsföring


**Personliga egenskaper**


* Strategisk och operativ – ser helheten men får samtidigt saker att hända
* Strukturerad och självgående – driver egna initiativ framåt
* Analytisk – grundar beslut i data och insikter
* Kommunikativ – trygg i dialog med olika funktioner
* Kommersiell – förstår affärslogik och har kunden i fokus
* Relationsbyggare – skapar nätverk och bygger förtroende
* Uthållig – fokuserar på lösningar snarare än problem

  


**Avslutningsvis**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placeringsort Malmö, tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Vi tillämpar provanställning.



Vi läser ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Skicka gärna din ansökan så snart du kan, senast **2025-11-07.** Innan anställning kan drogtest och bakgrundskontroll bli aktuella.



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

  


Optimera - Företagspresentation Optimera är en av Sveriges ledande bygghandelskedjor för yrkeskunder med fokus på kvalitet, service och flexibilitet. Vi är alltid på tå för att vara det självklara valet för proffs inom bygg. Vi ingår i Saint-Gobain Distribution Sweden som ägs av den franska industrikoncernen Saint-Gobain. SGDS omfattar bolagen Optimera, Bevego, Dahl, Kakelspecialisten och Konradssons Kakel. Tillsammans har vi Sveriges bredaste sortiment av produkter och tjänster inom området bygg och installation. Vi har över 150 000 proffskunder, omsätter drygt 19 miljarder, har över 180 etableringar och är nästan 3 000 medarbetare. Vi är specialister i samverkan – det gör oss unika på svensk marknad. Vi strävar alltid efter att göra allt lite bättre. https://saint-gobaindistribution.se/, https://www.optimera.se/bygghandel/proffs
**Kontakt:**


Malin Markerud
malin.markerud@optimera.se

title: Senior User Experience Designer
description:
Education changes lives. But tech hasn’t lived up to its promise for the more than 1 billion students in school around the world — at least not yet. At Kognity, we’re here to change that.


We’re a 125-person EdTech scale-up powering learning in 120+ countries. Our intelligent platform replaces traditional textbooks and combines rich, interactive pedagogy with smart AI and data to help students and teachers thrive — from international schools to US high schools.

**Why Kognity is the place to be:**

* Educational Innovation – Build AI-driven solutions that actually make learning better.
* Global Reach – Our platform supports educators and learners in over 120 countries.
* Driven Culture – Work with brilliant, hard-working people who care deeply about what they do.
* Real Growth – In every role at Kognity, you will be expected to grow.

**What you’ll do:**

* Design and deliver seamless user experiences by driving the end-to-end design flow (Discovery, Solution Design and Evaluation.)
* Play a key role in revolutionizing our design function; Design system, Information Architecture, metrics, Content & Typography guidelines, and Design principles.
* Conduct research to truly understand our users and inform wider product decisions; interviewing, prototyping, workshops, and validation.

**What we’re looking for:**

* A track record of successfully designing and delivering customer-facing digital products.
* UX research experience; Proficiency in user research techniques, qualitative/quantitative data, user testing, interviewing and consolidating.
* Visual & Interaction Design; Experience using typography, icons, illustrations, buttons, colours, and layouts to create visually appealing interfaces.
* Technical Skills: You’ll need to be well-versed in UX tools and technologies; examples include Figma, MixPanel, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

**Interview process**

* **Discovery Call with a Recruiter**: A friendly chat with a Recruiter to explore if the role is your perfect match.
* **Hiring manager discussion** - a talk with the VP of Product and Design to discuss the role in more detail.
* **Portfolio discussion**: A 30-minute discussion based on two of your recent projects with our design team.
* **Case study collab**: A 90-minute collaborative design task with the team.
* **Values Interview**: Share your journey by engaging in a lively discussion about your experiences, aligning them with the heartbeat of our company values.

**Our Values**

* **We take ownership –** We take initiative and act with self-leadership. We don’t wait for someone else to solve problems we see.
* **We leverage AI –** We apply AI to enhance creativity, decisions, and execution to allow for impact maximization.
* **We drive customer value –** Success for our customers drives our progress. We create value for them in everything we do.
* **We are transparent –** We are radically transparent with opinions and feedback, and we share information widely.
* **We take care of ourselves and each other –** We work hard and passionately, but also prioritise our own well-being, and that of our colleagues.

**Benefits**

* **Truly hybrid** – Work from our Stockholm office when you like
* **ITP Pension Plan** – With Nordnet
* **Wellness budget** – 5,000 SEK/year to spend on health-related services
* **30 vacation days** – Paid, every year
* **Sick leave** – Full pay from day one


Every qualified person will be evaluated regardless of age, gender, identity, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive team and welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.


See more about how we collect and process your personal data in our Privacy Notice.
company_description: Kognity is one the fastest growing EdTech companies in the world and we aim to radically improve learning for 1.5 billion school students globally.

title: UX-designer till uppdrag med fokus på komplexa system
description:
Vi söker nu en erfaren och engagerad UX-designer för vår kunds räkning. Du har förmågan att snabbt sätta dig in i projektets omfattning, användare och användningsfall, och spelar en nyckelroll i att identifiera och hantera utmaningar tidigt i processen. Målet är att säkerställa att projektet kan skalas upp utan hinder.
  
**Ansvarsområden:** Förstå och definiera projektets omfattning, målgrupp och användningsfall.
  
Identifiera och adressera utmaningar kopplade till användningsfall för att undvika hinder längre fram i projektet.
  
Planera och strukturera design- och forskningsarbete för en effektiv arbetsprocess.
  
Hantera komplexa system som innefattar både hård- och mjukvarukomponenter.
  
**Kvalifikationer:** Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom UX-design, gärna med fokus på hårdvarunära projekt.
  
Stark förmåga att analysera och hantera komplexa system med både hård- och mjukvaruelement.
  
Proaktiv problemlösare med förmåga att förutse och hantera potentiella utmaningar.
  
God kommunikationsförmåga, särskilt när det gäller att förklara teknisk information på ett begripligt sätt.
  
Självständig och effektiv i ett högt arbetstempo.
  
  

Det här är ett konsultuppdrag, med start omgående
  
Urval sker löpande, vänta inte med din ansökan!

title: Shopify Designer
description:
Founded in 2018 and headquartered in The Netherlands, GT Ecom BV is on a mission to build the most efficient global direct-to-consumer infrastructure and become the world’s largest e-commerce company—powered by a collective of successful, scalable brands. By 2026, we’re aiming to achieve $500 million in revenue and operate over 50 thriving online stores worldwide.


With a team of 160+ top-tier remote e-commerce professionals across the globe, we blend local brand experiences with cross-border logistics, ensuring every customer feels connected—no matter where they are.


At our core, we value hard work, freedom with responsibility, constant improvement, and a mindset of positivity. We believe in building a high-performance, remote-first culture where honesty, excellence, and creativity drive everything we do—because the future of work is global, and we’re building it together.

 **The Upsides of Working with Us**


**Hard Work That Matters**


We’re surrounded by people who care deeply and give their best. We don’t settle for average—we show up, push boundaries, and aim high. That shared drive creates momentum and meaning in everything we do.


**Freedom with Responsibility**


You have the freedom to choose how, when, and where you work—but freedom only thrives when it’s paired with ownership. We trust you to manage your time, meet your commitments, and take responsibility for your impact.


**Constant Improvement**


Growth is part of our DNA. We believe in learning, evolving, and getting 1% better every day. Whether it’s a new skill, a fresh mindset, or sharper execution—stagnation isn’t in our vocabulary.


**Positivity by Default**


We approach people, problems, and communication with a positive mindset. That means giving the benefit of the doubt, staying constructive, and keeping energy high—even when challenges arise.


️ **Honesty & Transparency**


We believe the fastest way to move forward is through clear, honest communication. No politics. No guessing games. Just straight talk that builds trust and strengthens our team.


**Excellence Is the Baseline**


We hold ourselves and each other to a high standard—not out of pressure, but out of pride. We care too much about what we’re building to accept "good enough." Excellence is the expectation.


**Creativity Welcome Here**


We encourage bold ideas, fast testing, and open collaboration. Failure doesn’t scare us—comfort does. That’s why creativity is valued as a core ingredient in everything from product to process.

 **We’re on the lookout for a** **Shopify Designer** **to join our expanding team and drive our company’s growth!**

 **The Challenge**


The company is dedicated to enhancing the performance of Shopify stores across a variety of markets. To support this initiative, we are on the lookout for a seasoned Designer with proven expertise in Shopify development. This role will be instrumental in building responsive, high-performance web applications that enhance user experience and drive conversions.

**Day in the Life of a Shopify Designer at GT Ecom**

* Implement user-friendly interfaces specifically for promotional offers on Shopify using HTML, CSS, and Javascript, ensuring a smooth and engaging customer experience.
* Work closely with the marketing team to translate promotional offer designs into functional and visually appealing web elements
* Enhance presentation and performance of promotional features within Shopify, focusing on improving user engagement and conversion rates.
* Perform thorough testing and debugging of promotional implementations on Shopify to guarantee seamless functionality prior to deployment
* Regularly maintain and improve existing Shopify codebases related to promotional offers

 **Your Team When You Join Us**


In this role, you will be reporting to the Bulk Store Manager and work alongside an eight-member global team to develop and implement marketing strategies aimed at increasing bulk product visibility and sales through effective campaigns and engaging content.


**We would love to hear from you if…**

* You have at least 1 year of experience in Shopify design and front-end development.
* You are proficient in Shopify Liquid, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and theme development, with experience in APIs, app integrations, responsive design, and performance optimization. Skilled in debugging, version control, and delivering scalable, high-quality code.
* You have a strong eye for UI/UX, branding, and visual design, able to craft engaging, conversion-focused storefronts. You are experienced with Figma/Adobe XD and excel at blending aesthetic design with functional usability.
* You have demonstrated expertise in responsive design principles, particularly in building promotional layouts that adapt seamlessly across devices.
* You possess excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and strong communication abilities, enabling you to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

  

If you are excited about the opportunity and feel like you are a good fit, we encourage you to apply today and talk to one of our recruiters. We look forward to seeing how your skills and experiences align with our vision. If unsure, we still welcome your application and would be happy to discuss other potential roles that may be a good fit for you.

 **Overview of Our Interview Process**



* **Application Submission** - We’ll start by reviewing your application.


* **Unpaid Trial Task -** Create a banner for mobile and desktop view


* **HR Interview -** One of our recruiters will invite you to the HR interview


* **Paid Trial Task -** We will invite you to do the paid trial task


* **Final Interview -** Meet with the Hiring Manager


* **Offer Discussion** - If all goes well, we'll discuss the offer and invite you to our pre-onboarding process.


* **Pre-Onboarding Process**

	+ **Background Check:** Verification of your identification and declared address.

	+ **Reference Check:** We’ll contact your three references for their feedback.
* **Onboarding:** Once all checks are completed, we’ll initiate the onboarding process.
 **Let’s Set Expectations First**

  

* This is **not** a salaried position. This is an **Independent Contractor role**.
* You must be able to commit at least 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week.
* We require everybody in the team to use Hubstaff (https://hubstaff.com/) to track hours worked.

**Compensation**

* We pay on an hourly basis.
* 

If you are excited about the opportunity and feel like you are a good fit, we encourage you to apply today and talk to one of our recruiters. We look forward to seeing how your skills and experiences align with our vision.

title: Technical Product Lead
description:
### **Technical Product Lead**

#### **About the Role**


As the technical product lead, you’ll lead a cross-functional team of frontend developers and a UX designer, owning the end-to-end storefront experience. You’ll sit at the intersection of business, technology, and design. You’ll own the product management process: gathering requirements, prioritizing initiatives, and collaborating closely with engineering, design, and business stakeholders. With your engineering foundation, you’ll combine technical depth with product leadership: ensuring we build scalable solutions that delight customers while driving the business forward.


Your mission is to make shopping with Photowall seamless, personalized, and inspiring - from navigation to checkout.


**What You’ll Do**

  

* Lead the storefront & user-experience team
* Own the customer-facing product roadmap and vision for our storefront
* Translate business goals and customer insights into clear, actionable product requirements
* Prioritize initiatives with leadership, balancing quick wins with long-term impact
* Collaborate hands-on with engineers and designers to deliver elegant, high-performing solutions
* Use data, analytics, and experimentation to guide decision-making and measure success
* Work on projects that combine personalization, UX innovation, and AI

**What We’re Looking For**

* Technical background (engineering, computer science, or equivalent work experience)
* 5+ years of experience in product management or product ownership in e-commerce or digital products
* Strong ability to bridge business needs with technical feasibility
* Experience in UX-driven product development and working closely with frontend teams
* Analytical mindset: comfortable with data, dashboards, and A/B testing
* Excellent communicator who thrives in cross-functional collaboration

#### **About Photowall**


Photowall is a global leader in custom wallpaper and wall decor. We serve over 20 markets, and have ambitious plans for continued growth through geographic expansion and new product launches. At Photowall, you’ll find a dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional development.


As part of the Network of Design (NOD), we are constantly innovating and striving for excellence. If you’re passionate about design and eager to grow, Photowall is the place for you.We believe in innovation, personal development, and working together to achieve greatness. We can’t wait to welcome you aboard as a key player in our exciting journey!


Apply today and help us shape the future of Photowall!

title: Design System Specialist
description:
We are on the lookout for a Design System Specialist who is deeply passionate about crafting visually stunning and highly scalable design systems. In this pivotal role at Above, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of our clients' products, ensuring a cohesive and user-centric experience across their diverse range of services.

 **Once here you will:**

* Lead the creation and implementation of comprehensive design systems that cater to the needs of complex enterprise systems.
* Work closely with multidisciplinary teams, including UX/UI designers, developers, and product managers, to ensure a seamless and efficient user experience across all platforms.
* Establish and uphold design guidelines, best practices, and standards to maintain consistency and quality.
* Develop and manage design tokens and automation processes to enhance workflow efficiency and team collaboration.
* Actively evaluate and refine the design system to meet evolving user requirements and technological advancements.
* Advocate for design system methodologies within the client's organisation, mentoring team members and promoting a culture of design innovation.

 **What makes you a great fit**

* A visual design expert with a strong portfolio that demonstrates your skill and experience in developing large-scale design systems.
* 5+ years of experience with design systems, particularly in creating and evolving design systems for complex enterprise environments.
* Proficiency in Figma and familiarity with tools like GitHub, Supernova, or similar.
* A deep understanding of automation tools, design token structure, and their integration into design workflows.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, capable of engaging with diverse teams and stakeholders.
* A strategic thinker with a problem-solving mindset, adept at translating business needs into creative design solutions.

 **What Above has to offer**


At Above you’ll have the chance to bring products to life for some of the world's most exciting clients. We’re a team of warm, welcoming, dedicated people that love to create amazing stuff together!

  

* Diverse assignments and client portfolio
* Access to support system of experts and personal coaches
* An inclusive and refined development process — when one of us grows, everyone grows
* Central Stockholm location
* Actively promote caring and supportive leadership
* Competitive compensation package
* Access to Eidra's network of experts, from Brand Strategy to Tech Development
* 

**A bit about Above**


Above is a Scandinavian innovation agency dedicated to driving positive change through the integration of strategy, design, and technology. We collaborate with global brands and emerging startups to craft futures that are optimistic, sustainable, and enjoyable.


We encourage applications from candidates who can contribute to the diversity of our organisation. Our commitment to an inclusive workplace extends across all aspects of our recruitment and employment practices.

 **How to apply**


To apply, please submit your resume, and your portfolio. In your portfolio, we want to see some of your best work and how you influenced the process & end result.


We're excited to hear from you!

title: UI/UX Design Intern
company_industry: Mechanical Or Industrial Engineering, Technology, Information and Internet, and Information Services
description:
**Join the Creative Team at Coursfy as a UI/UX Design Intern!**
 Are you a creative and detail-oriented individual with a passion for both user interface and user experience design? Do you have a keen eye for aesthetics and a drive to create intuitive, engaging user experiences? If so, we have an exciting internship opportunity for you!
   

  

**Position** 
 : UI/UX Design Intern
   

  

**About Coursfy**
 Coursfy is an innovative e-learning platform designed to provide maximum freedom to both instructors and learners. We emphasize flexibility, creativity, and autonomy, empowering instructors to deliver unique educational experiences and allowing learners to tailor their educational journeys. Our platform is built on advanced technology and is committed to delivering a seamless, intuitive user experience that prioritizes ease of use.
   

  

 Why Join Coursfy?
   

  

* Innovative Environment: Be part of a cutting-edge platform that is redefining online education.
* Impactful Work: Your contributions will directly enhance the learning experience for millions of users worldwide.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a team of passionate professionals dedicated to making a difference.
* Career Growth: Gain valuable experience and professional development in a supportive learning environment.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Assist in the creation and implementation of user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) designs for web and mobile applications.
* Develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to communicate design ideas effectively.
* Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and refine designs.
* Collaborate with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to ensure a cohesive and user-friendly design.
* Ensure all designs are consistent with Coursfy’s brand guidelines and design standards.
* Stay updated with the latest design trends and best practices to continually improve our UI/UX design.


**Requirements**
* Currently pursuing (or recently graduated from) a degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, Visual Arts, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, or similar software.
* Strong understanding of UI/UX design principles, typography, color theory, and layout.
* Ability to create high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Strong attention to detail and a passion for creating visually appealing and user-friendly designs.
* Ability to take feedback constructively and iterate on designs.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Experience with responsive design and designing for multiple devices.
* Previous internship or project experience in UI/UX design.

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
 



  





 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers to bring your ideas to life—creating products that are both beautiful and usable. Depending on your experience, you might implement parts of the frontend yourself or work alongside developers to ensure your vision is realized in the final product.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: UX/UI designer (LIA), Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to make a difference for millions of users? Join PostNord’s UX team as an intern.
   

  

 We, the UX team, are working in an agile environment where the teams independently own the product from start to finish. Within the team, it is important that everybody has their say, and we always strive to improve our way of working.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm. We make sure to meet each other in our office in Solna, at least three days per week. Find out more and follow us on LinkedIn!
   

  

 ,
   

  

 Are you curious about UX design and eager to gain experience in a large company whose digital services are used by both private individuals and businesses? Then PostNord is the right place for you.
   

  

 As an intern, you’ll be part of our UX team and work closely with developers, product owners, and other specialists to create simple and user-friendly experiences. With us you will
   

  

* Gain experience from projects that make a difference for our users
* Get insights into the full UX process, from research and analysis to prototypes and usability testing.
* Receive support and guidance from experienced UX designers who are happy to share their knowledge


 We believe an internship should be more than just practice. It should give you valuable experience and a true understanding of what it’s like to work in a dynamic and constantly evolving organization.
   

  

**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com.
   

  

  

  

**Apply**
 Send us a short presentation about yourself, why you’d like to do your internship with us, and the period you are available.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Strategic Marketing Intern
description:
**The Gang**
 Since 2019,
 **The Gang** 
 has been a leading gaming studio for Roblox games and our goal is to build the best, safest, and most engaging experiences in the world. We publish our own games and develop game experiences with the most successful brands in the world in music, fashion, entertainment and technology.
   

  

 Our mission is to unlock the full creative potential of our audiences with innovative experiences and solutions. This year we have seen tremendous growth with several million active users every day and we are actively looking to find the best people to join us in shaping the future of metaverse experiences in Roblox and beyond. Not only have we seen a growth in our games, but also a growth in our team. We've grown from just Sweden to also have offices in Portugal, the UK, and now Malaysia and Indonesia.
   

  

**About The Position**
 Are you passionate about creating groundbreaking work for global brands and dream of building your career at the worldʼs top advertising agencies? Do you live and breathe pop-culture, social media, and ideation?
   

  

 If yes, weʼre looking for you. Our award-winning studio is seeking a driven and excited strategic marketing to join our team. This is your chance to collaborate with some of the brightest minds in new advertising media, crafting transformative experiences for brands that push the boundaries of creativity and technology.
   

  

 Your responsibilities would include the following:
   

  

* Assist in the concept development and execution of interactive and experiential campaigns for global brands.
* Research social media trends and audience media consumption to provide insights and recommendations for projects.
* Support project management tasks, ensuring seamless coordination across creative, tech, and production teams.
* Participate in brainstorming sessions, contributing ideas for campaigns and strategies.
* Assist in creating pitch materials, decks, and case studies showcasing our work and vision.
* Conduct competitor analysis and market research to identify opportunities for innovation.


**Life at The Gang - Fun, playful, fearless and always going forward!**
 We strive to deliver awesome digital experiences and have fun while doing it, always learning and moving forward. Working at The Gang you will have a lot of ownership over your tasks and be empowered to test your ideas and grow in a playful and supportive group.
   

  

 Starting date: Now, permanent contract after 6 months probationary period
   

  

 Location: Sweden, working in a hybrid model from our Stockholm office or from home. Discord and Slack are your best friends!
   

  

 Work time: Full time
   

  

 Company language: English
   

  

 To apply for this role, please submit your CV in English. This internship must be tied to full-time studies and is eligible for CSN.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Trendspotter: You have your finger on the pulse of pop culture, gaming, social media, and digital trends.
* Creatively Curious: Youʼre passionate about storytelling, user engagement, and creating emotional connections through interactive mediums.
* Team Player: You thrive in collaborative environments and bring a positive, can-do attitude to every project.


**Required Qualifications**
* Currently pursuing a degree in Advertising, Marketing, Design, or a related field.
* Basic understanding of or experience with creative software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, or similar).
* Strong presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal.
* A portfolio or examples of past work (projects, prototypes, or coursework) that


**What We Offer**
 showcase your skills and passion.
   

  

* Hands-on experience working on innovative projects for globally recognized brands
* Mentorship from industry-leading creatives and strategists
* Insight into the inner workings of an award-winning studio
* Opportunities to contribute meaningfully to projects that push the boundaries of creativity and technology
* The opportunity to work with a diverse, fun, and talented team


 At The Gang, we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and open workplace. We have players of every race, gender, color, sexual orientation, nationality, and religion - naturally we want our employees to have this too. We value and welcome your unique background!

title: Creative Content Designer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
 As a Creative Content Designer, you'll play a crucial role in our mission to pitch our music to Digital Service Providers with our own editorial playlists, a strategy that is key to increasing our share of streams and revenue. Your role will be to create compelling creative for paid and organic content at scale, an internal capability we currently lack, to help us test, iterate, and double down on what works to get our music in front of more people. You'll collaborate closely with our Ads Manager, Performance Marketing Manager, and YouTube Channel Growth Manager, taking full ownership of the end-to-end creative process to generate tangible business results.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Producing compelling ad creative and looping video mixes for our playlists and YouTube channels.
* Creating assets for artist marketing to promote our world-leading mood music catalog.
* Leveraging creative tools, including AI video creation tools, to produce work efficiently.
* Analyzing the performance of ad creative using data to inform testing and iterations.


**Requirements**
* A strong marketing mindset with the ability to translate creative work into business outcomes.
* Proficiency with creative software like Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or DaVinci.
* Experience in artist marketing, particularly within the music industry.
* Experience from having full ownership of the creative process from start to finish.
* Strong creative and copywriting skills.
* Analytically minded with a data-driven approach.
* High ability to collaborate effectively with different stakeholders and partners.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

*Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound talks straight to the camera about the emotional side of Epidemic Sound, what the company is trying to achieve and the perfect X that we look for in our people. Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.*
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Co-Founder - Social Media & Content Creation
description:
About Chamberly AB
 





 Founded in 2023, Chamberly AB is a fast-growing Swedish startup on a mission to make mental well-being more accessible and supportive through technology. Our mobile app which is available on iOS and coming soon to Android, offers a safe, anonymous space for mental support. With over 100K downloads and an outstanding 4.8/5 rating globally, we’re proud to be making a meaningful impact. Join us in shaping the future of mental health support.
 




  






 We sometimes call Chamberly the tinder of mental health due to its highly interactive UI that connects listeners with users that want to vent about certain topics. Chamberly isn’t just a mental health platform, it’s a place to find your permanent emotional well-being partner that shares the same interest and life experiences as you, allowing users to wander off with their new found caring and relating best friend.
 




  






 We are young founders that leverage the latest AI technologies to build powerful features that make Chamberly a safe, highly-effective and fun place to be in.
 




  






 Please note:
 

 This is an unpaid position during the partnership trial. If you're a great fit, you’ll transition into a partner/co-founder role with equity and future compensation.
 




  






 Responsibility
 




*Social Media Strategy & Content Creation* 





 Take the lead on managing Chamberly’s presence on LinkedIn, Instagram, Tiktok, (and beyond!). You'll create thoughtful, engaging content and develop a clear strategy to grow our visibility, drive meaningful engagement, and build a strong online community around mental health.
 




  





*Event Planning & Community Engagement* 





 Plan and organize interactive events, both in-app (to keep our users inspired and engaged) and within the team (think about fun meetups, bonding activities, and team-building moments). You’ll be both the planner and the motivator who helps bring people together with purpose and joy.
 




  





*Culture Shaping* 





 Establish a culture of safety, kindness, creativity, and collaboration, for both our users and our team. You’ll help define and nurture the spirit of Chamberly, making sure it’s a place where people feel seen, supported, and empowered to grow.
 




  






 Your Experience (Required):
 



* Experience in creating content on multiple platforms and growing a followers base.
* Experience leading communities on Instagram, Tiktok, LinkedIn, or similar platforms.
* Are an active and curious user on various social media platforms, with a strong understanding of how different platforms work and what makes content truly connect with people.
* Have hands-on experience creating engaging content, and are comfortable using tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Express, Figma or similar for image and video editing.
* Bring a vibrant personality to the table: You're outgoing, empathetic, charismatic, and full of positive energy that uplifts both users and teammates.
* Communicate fluently in English (our working language), both in writing and speaking.



  






 Bonus Experience (Nice to have):
 



* Experience or passion for mental health, wellness, or emotional well-being
* Have the ability to lead, motivate, and mentor teams.
* Active involvement in community-driven causes (e.g., mental health advocacy, LGBTQ+ support, sustainability, animal welfare)
* A neutral public profile when it comes to political or geopolitical topics.
* Experience collaborating across cultures or remote, international teams.
* An international background with ability to communicate fluently in Swedish, both in writing and speaking.



  






 Flexibility & Freedom
 



* Choose your own working hours
* Hybrid: Mostly remote
* Easily fits alongside studies or other commitments



  






 Note:
 





 Even if you’re a half baked red velvet and don’t fulfill all the above, we may still find you super interesting!
 




  






 At Chamberly, we’re committed to creating an inclusive and respectful workplace. Your gender, ethnicity, religion, or any other personal trait will never affect your opportunity with us.
 




  






 Know someone perfect for this?
 





 Feel free to share this opportunity with them!
 




  






 Interested?
 





 Apply by submitting the form 😍

title: Senior User Researcher
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We are seeking a user researcher to join our User Research team and partner directly with our Product Growth team. In this role, you will be responsible for leading research that helps us understand our users' journeys, from their initial discovery of our product to long-term engagement. Your work will directly influence our strategies for user acquisition, onboarding, and retention, helping us create a more seamless and valuable experience for new and existing users.
 



  





**Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.** 




  





**What you will be doing** 



* **Lead the research:** 
 Plan and execute a variety of research studies focused on the user growth lifecycle. This includes understanding the motivations of potential users, identifying barriers in the onboarding process, and uncovering reasons for user churn.
* **Conduct impactful research:** 
 Use a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods, such as usability testing, A/B testing, surveys, competitor analysis, and user interviews, to gather insights that inform product decisions.
* **Partner with the team:** 
 Work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and data analysts to embed user research into the product development process. Help the team develop and test hypotheses for new growth initiatives.
* **Communicate findings:** 
 Synthesize and present research findings in a clear, compelling way to stakeholders across the organization. You'll be the voice of the user, helping the team understand what they need to improve their experience.
* **Build a research plan:** 
 Develop a long-term research roadmap for the Product Growth team, ensuring our research efforts are strategically aligned with business goals.



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* **Experience in user research:** 
 Proven experience conducting user research, ideally with a focus on product growth, user acquisition, or conversion.
* **Proficiency in research methods:** 
 Strong command of research methodologies, including qualitative interviews, usability testing, and survey design. Experience in quantitative methods is a plus.
* **Collaboration skills:** 
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with cross-functional teams.
* **Business- & data-driven mindset:** 
 A key player in connecting user insights to business outcomes. Someone who can translate user stories into actionable recommendations by linking qualitative data to quantitative product metrics.
* **Strategic thinking:** 
 A desire to not just answer questions, but to uncover the most important questions the team should be asking to drive business impact.
* **Additional languages:** 
 Fluency in additional languages — particularly German or Portuguese — is a plus.



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will work alongside knowledgeable colleagues in the continuous growth and skill enhancement environment
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the User Research team you will work with is located in Stockholm, and the team occasionally meets in the office for collaboration and face-to-face time.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
 



  





  





**Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Product Owner
description:
**Description**
**Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights, TUI, etc.**
**Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 3000 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Canada, Greece, India, Poland.**
 The vision of the Product team is to work with speed, passion, dedication, and with a “getting things done” approach ensuring that we are doing the right things connected to the Group strategy. In sync with the growing targets and needs, we are growing the Product team and on the lookout for new Product Owners to join our Air Content, Ancillary, Foundation, Payments & Post Booking Automation.
   

  

**The role as Product Owner**
 Initially you will be working alongside a Senior Product Owner to ensure development targets are met around the given domain. You will join her/his daily work with the development teams, coordinating Business Owners, Product Managers, Project Managers, CX, UX, Developers as well as other stakeholders.. By coaching and hands-on involvement with real projects you will gradually transition into a high degree of autonomy with the goal to lead your own team.
   

  

 With an entrepreneurial mindset you will be responsible for
   

  

* Being part of the long term product/domain plan and requirement assessment process.
* Ensuring knowledge sharing throughout the organization and that stakeholders are updated continuously with the latest status.
* Providing post-release and day-to-day support by collecting, filtering, organizing, prioritizing and following up bug reports and questions.
* Identifying problems/opportunities within your domain and bringing them to life.


**Team Descriptions**
* Air Content


 The mission of Air Content is to ensure that Etraveli Group offers the widest array of relevant air content in the world, facilitating the customer's booking process and generating value to our customers and partners. The team interacts with stakeholders across all business domains (e.g. Sales, Operations, Commercial), directly with our partners (e.g. Metas, Booking.com) and with development teams across business domains (e.g. Customer Facing, Ancillaries, Post Booking). Within 2024 special focus will be placed on ensuring we meet ours and Bcom’s goals on increasing sales originating from Bcom direct traffic.
   

  

* Ancillary


 The mission of the Ancillary teams is to ensure that Etraveli Group have relevant ancillary offering to enhance the travel experience both pre, during and post travel and by that generating value to our customers and partners.
   

  

 The teams interacts with stakeholders across all business domains (e.g. Sales, Customer Service, Commercial), directly with our partners (e.g. Metas, Booking.com) and with other development teams across business domains (e.g. Foundation, Post Booking Automation, Air Content).
   

  

* Payments


 The mission of the Payment teams is to offer frictionless payments both for customers and carriers, as well as protecting the company from fraudulent payment attempts. Payment domain consists of 4 development teams, located in Athens, Gothenburg and Montevideo. Customer Payments team (Athens, Montevideo) handling the onboarding of global and localised payment methods and providers. Risk management team (Athens) that is responsible for the company’s fraud management system and intelligence. And Supplier Payments team (Gothenburg) in charge of the expansion of the payment portfolio to facilitate airline payments and the development of features to increase automation on product steering processes.
   

  

* Post Booking Automation


 The vision of the Post Booking Automation teams is to manage changes and cancellations on customer bookings. We focus on creating automation, self-service solutions and agent tools that empower both our customers and our partners. As a Product Owner in this domain, you will play a key role in shaping and delivering seamless experiences that ensure quick, efficient and reliable handling of customer requests. Your work will directly impact how travelers and agents manage bookings.
   

  

* Foundation


 The mission of the Foundation teams is to help our customers and agents in the best way across all processes and interfaces. The domain includes development teams managing the interfaces towards customers, including App and Web. It also includes the agent-facing platforms we use as well as teams focusing on ensuring the reconciliation and accounting is done accurately for the different processes leading to a financial transaction. As a Product Owner you take part in deciding on how we should tackle this in the best way together with developers, UX personnel and stakeholders in both Sweden, Greece and India.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have the ability to break down a complex concept/process into simpler parts and present it to someone with less insights.
* You are used to working with people and have excellent communication skills (verbal and written communication), being able to tailor your language to the audience you refer to.
* You thrive when taking on new responsibilities and feel comfortable making decisions.
* Ability to deliver a data driven approach with a customer-first mindset.


**Meritorious**
 Some technical knowledge of how GDS and/or LCC booking processes work.
   

  

 Experience of working in internal ETG tools like Edvin, Looker etc.
   

  

 Experience of working in documentation programs such as Atlassian or Figma. Experience of the Agile world such as Scrum and/or Kanban.
   

  

 Previous experience working with AI technologies is considered an asset.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Working at Etraveli Group means working at a fast-growing company with high ambitions in becoming the number one Online travel agency worldwide. The culture at the company embraces complexity and we like to keep the entrepreneurial spirit even as we grow into being a larger company. You will have awesome colleagues with whom you will have fun solving complex problems in a fast-moving business.
   

  

**We Also Offer**
* A flexible working environment. We work on a hybrid-model where you can choose to work two days from home and you will have two weeks per year that you can choose to work from a remote location
* Central office location in the City – We are located on Regeringsgatan in Stockholm, a stone's throw from public transport and lunch restaurants.
* Healthcare allowance – Each employee receives a maximum allowable amount each year according to the Swedish Tax Agency to spend on health-promoting activities such as a gym card, massage etc.
* Pension and health insurance – Through partners we offer a comprehensive pension and health insurance so that you can get help quickly in case of an accident
* Enjoy a vibrant company culture with daily office breakfasts, a weekly fika club, a ping pong table for friendly matches, and exciting events like our summer mingle and Christmas party.


**As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.**
*At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds.* 
*During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.*
**Welcome to Etraveli Group!**

title: Head of Product
description:
**We have chosen to work with Ada Digital in this recruitment. The recruitment process is managed entirely by Ada Digital, and you are welcome to submit your application through their website. You'll access their advertisement after you click on the Apply-button above.** 




  





**Get to know us** 




 The Swedish Postcode Lottery is part of the Postcode Lottery Group. Together with 1,500 colleagues in the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, Germany and Norway, we create a safe and entertaining lottery experience for customers while contributing to something greater.
 



  





 We are on a transformation journey to build scalable, best-in-class digital products that enable exceptional customer and user journeys. To drive this forward, we are further establishing Group Product as a function across all markets, with a focus on shared solutions such as an international CMS platform, mobile apps and a consolidation of our 5 different local back-end systems into one international platform. In Sweden, we are now looking for a Head of Product who can bring clarity in complexity, connect local and global priorities, and lead a local senior team through change and growth while also being part of a senior management team leading the international product transformation.
 



  





**THE OPPORTUNITY** 




 As Swedish Head of Product, you will lead a team of Product Owners and a Product designer, focusing on our digital lottery product – website, payments, loyalty, app and SaaS solutions. You will represent Sweden within the international Group Product organisation, aligning the local roadmap with group-wide frameworks and shared platforms.
 



 You are part of the International Product Leadership team, and one of the Swedish management teams, consisting of Managing Director and Heads of Department. Reporting both locally to one of the Swedish Managing Directors and internationally to the Group Product Director, you will play a key role in bridging local and global priorities.
 



  





**YOUR CHALLENGE** 




 Your challenge is to bring out the best in a senior team, inspire innovation and make sure our digital lottery products keep evolving with our customers’ needs and in alignment with the Group’s shared platforms and vision. You will:
 



  




* Further develop and articulate a clear, strategic vision for all product lines “the what” and functional disciplines on ‘the how’, together with the Group Product leadership team.
* Lead, mentor, and empower the team in this period of change, fostering a culture of curiosity, collaboration and continuous learning. And inspire the team to embrace the new transformational journey.
* Oversee the entire product lifecycle together with the Group Product leadership team, from conception through launch and iteration, ensuring that they meet market needs and customer expectations.
* Have both international and local responsibility, leveraging the value of close collaboration with cross-functional teams and colleagues internationally and locally.
* Foster a culture of product innovation through deep market and user research, competitive analysis, and a keen understanding of emerging trends and technologies.
* Further set and track high-quality product roadmaps, processes, as well as KPIs, to measure product success and inform future development.
* Manage stakeholder relationships, effectively communicating product vision, strategy, and progress to executives, team members, and external partners.



  





  





**THE TEAM AND WORKPLACE** 




 This role is based in our Stockholm Office, located at Klarabergsviadukten 63. Our culture is value-driven – courage, sustainability, sharing and fun – and we believe in a generous, collaborative way of working at our beautiful office, with flexibility to work remotely when needed.
 



  





 Travel is an important part of the role, with regular visits to Amsterdam and occasional trips to other markets. You will join an international network of peers while leading a highly engaged team locally in Sweden.
 



  





**ABOUT YOU** 




 We are looking for a senior product leader with a strong track record in digital product management and a leadership style that combines clarity with empathy. You bring:
 



  




* 10+ years of experience in product management and leadership
* Proven track record of leading and driving forward a digital transformation.
* Strong EQ, servant leadership qualities and the ability to inspire trust and collaboration.
* Comfort in international, matrix-based organisations, with proven cross-cultural competence.
* Strategic mindset combined with pragmatism and the ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity, translating them into clear direction and outcomes.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**Good to know:** 




 Parts of this recruitment process will be held in English, which means that your application as a whole needs to be written in English.

title: Fullstack Developer (focus on Frontend & Golang)
description:
**Location:** 
 Uppsala / Stockholm (hybrid, 1 day per week on-site)
   

  

**Workload:** 
 100%
   

  

**Start:** 
 Mid-November 2025
   

  

**End:** 
 Summer 2026 (possible extension)
   

  

**Assignment Description**
 On behalf of our client, we are looking for a
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 with a strong
 **frontend profile** 
 and solid experience in
 **Golang** 
 . You will replace one of two Fullstack Developers in a small team that is transitioning from primarily frontend development toward a more fullstack architecture.
   

  

 This is a

 role that involves both hands-on development and the opportunity to contribute with coaching and technical guidance within the team.
   

  

 You likely have a background in

 using JavaScript/TypeScript, and ideally experience building

 and typically meets

 on-site.
   

  

 Planned start is

 , and the assignment runs until
