title: MARKETING TECHNOLOGY SPECIALIST
description:
City: Solna
Job Function: Other
**Marketing Technology Specialist**
-----------------------------------



As a Marketing Technology Specialist within SAS Commercial you will be responsible for innovating and solving technical challenges within marketing in general and paid media in particular.

  



Your role includes maintaining and optimizing existing systems and creating new solutions to enhance our media buying and data collection capabilities. Key tasks include maintaining current and creating new audience segments, collecting data for our Marketing Mix Modeling tool (MMM), and developing tools for Dynamic creative optimization (DCO) and SEM, among others.

  



As a person we believe you have a problem-solving attitude and strive in leading initiatives to research, investigate, and implement technical solutions to meet business needs. You will continuously evaluate new technologies, assess feasibility, and recommend the best solutions considering cost, impact, and effort.

**Challenges you will work on:**
--------------------------------


*Innovate and Solve Technical Challenges:*  

* Support Media Specialists by developing and maintaining technical solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness in media buying and data analysis

*Audience Management:*  

* Develop and maintain customer segments for media platforms like Google, Meta, and Snapchat
* Understand APIs and hashing methods or secure data sharing.
* Work with JSON formats, Python scripting, and perform basic server maintenance in Google Cloud

*Data Collection for MMM:*  

* Collect, manage, and oversee the quarterly data collection process for MMM, ensuring all relevant data points are accurately captured and processed
* Maintain communication with internal and external stakeholders to ensure timely data collection and processing
* Pre-process data files, primarily in CSV and Excel formats, for analysis

*Navigating the Cloud:*  

* Operate and manage tasks within the Google Cloud Platform, including virtual machines, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler, and BigQuery

*Technical Documentation and Compliance:*  

* Act as a liaison between IT, legal, and marketing team, ensuring data is handled per GDPR and other regulations
* Draft technical documentation such as Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) and Records of Processing Activities (ROPAs)
  


**To be successful, we believe you have:**  

* Minimum 3 years’ experience on client or agency side, working with digital marketing and/or marketing technology
* MSc/BSc in Marketing, Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant fields
* Deep knowledge and understanding of the digital marketing landscape – both from a marketing and technical point of view
* Hands-On Experience with Media Buying Platforms, proficient in using platforms such as Google, Meta, Snapchat, and TikTok for media buying
* Deep understanding and knowledge of how to build, operate and maintain technology used by digital marketing (eg Google Analytics, GTM, DV360, SA360)
* Familiarity with Python, Node.js, PHP, SQL, JavaScript, HTML
* Knowledge of cloud functions and RESTful APIs
* Experience from working with analysis in a digital media context
* Proficiency in managing and analyzing large datasets, especially for marketing and sales performance evaluation
* Strong skills in Excel and CSV file processing
* Familiarity with SFTP servers for file handling
* Understanding of GDPR and data compliance requirements
* Experience in drafting and maintaining technical documentation and policies
**Why SAS?**
------------



At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.
  

**Our Culture at SAS**  

At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!

  

**Additional information**  

* Deadline for application: 23/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: Asap
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna or Copenhagen, and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
  



Come and fly with us!


SAS, Scandinavia's leading airline since 1946, operates from its principal hub at Copenhagen Airport (CPH), complemented by hubs in Oslo (OSL) and Stockholm (ARN). Our mission is to connect Scandinavia with the world and the world with Scandinavia. Each year, SAS serves more than 25 million passengers and transports 55 tons of cargo to 135 destinations across Europe, the USA, and Asia. With a passionate workforce of over 10,000 colleagues, we collaborate with partners and customers to drive transformative changes in aviation. We are committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, embodying the visionary spirit of our founders: “To move from the old to what is about to come, is the only tradition worth keeping”. Innovation and societal progress are at the heart of everything we do. For

title: CUSTOMER ANALYST
description:
City: Solna
Job Function: Other
**Do you want to take SAS customer analytics to the next level?**
-----------------------------------------------------------------



Welcome to SAS and the customer team! We are a part of SAS Commercial and responsible for analyzing marketing and customer data to better understand and predict our customers’ needs and behavior. We are now looking for a customer analyst that will be part of SAS’s analytics team and play an important role in our ambition to create a world-class customer experience.

**Challenges you will work on:**
--------------------------------



As a Customer Analyst, you will be part of a cross-functional team who is responsible for SAS Marketing and CRM communication. You will provide analysis of customer behaviors, insights and knowledge of customers’ response and predict future actions.  

  

**Key responsibilities and tasks:**  

* Evaluate marketing campaigns and CRM communication to give insights and recommendations on how to maximize the effect of those.
* Perform analysis and create basis for decisions on e.g. creation of new automated campaigns and personalization measures.
* Help optimize and personalize customer communication in omni-channel to maximize customer experience.
* Define and set up customer segmentation.
* Create scripts and jobs in our data warehouse to gather data needed for target groups and perform analysis.
* Evaluate, test, build and maintain scoring models and target groups to maximize customer experience and the effect of marketing initiatives.
  

**To be successful, we believe you have:**  

* Master’s degree in relevant field such as Business administration, Economics or Statistics.
* Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience.
* Strong SQL skills.
* Experience working with CRM and/or Data Analytics.
* Experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud will be considered a big plus.
* Experience from working with analysis in a digital media context (e.g. with Google Analytics/BigQuery or similar platform).
* Knowledge in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).

  

  

As a person we believe that you have the ability to see the big picture, while you are accurate and can secure details. You are result-oriented, dedicated, reliable in delivery and have an ability to independently run and lead projects. Furthermore, you have very good analytical skills, are interested in handling large amounts of data and have the ability to see patterns and draw conclusions that support the commercials.**Why SAS?**
------------

* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.
  

**Our Culture at SAS**  

At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!

  

**Additional information**  

* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: Asap
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna or Copenhagen, and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.

Our mission is to connect Scandinavia with the world and the world with Scandinavia. With a passionate workforce of over 10,000 colleagues, we collaborate with partners and customers to drive transformative changes in aviation. We are committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, embodying the visionary spirit of our founders: “To move from the old to what is about to come, is the only tradition worth keeping”. title: Independent Software Vendors Marketing Manager
description:
**Shape the Future of Payments with Nexi in 2025**  

Envision a world where every transaction feels effortless, safe, and connected. At Nexi, we’re leading this transformation, building tools and solutions that redefine how the world pays. By joining us, you’ll play a part in creating the next generation of digital payments in an innovative, international environment.
  

  

**Why This Role Is Right for You**  

As an **Independent Software Vendors Partner Marketing Manager** , you’ll join a collaborative and forward-thinking team based in Sweeden. Together, we work on partnering with local Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) to co-develop and scale joint go-to-market plans that drive adoption of Nexi payment solutions among SME merchants and accelerate pipeline growth across the market.
  

  

**About Your Future Role**  

In this position, you will:


* Develop and execute joint GTM strategies and integrated partner marketing campaigns (digital advertising, content, webinars, events, social) with Independent Software Vendors partners to generate qualified leads and pipeline.
* Own the partner marketing lifecycle for your market — partner acquisition, onboarding, lead nurturing, MDF management and performance reporting.
* Create partner enablement assets (playbooks, battlecards, decks, case studies and webinars) that help Partner Sales convert faster.
* Plan and deliver local partner events and build partner communities to increase engagement and brand awareness.
* Coordinate with Product, Proposition and Central Partner teams to localise offers and feed market insights into product and proposition development.
* Continuously monitor campaign performance and optimise using data and marketing automation/CRM insights.
Manage local budgets, vendor and agency relationships to deliver campaigns on time and on budget.  
* 

**What Makes You a Great Fit**  

We’re looking for someone eager to make a difference. Here’s what we value:
  

  

**Essential Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field.
* Significant experience in B2B marketing with demonstrated partner/ Independent Software Vendors marketing experience.
* Strong hands-on experience with marketing automation and CRM tools (e.g., Marketo, HubSpot, Salesforce) and campaign analytics.
* Proven experience delivering integrated demand-generation campaigns that drive measurable pipeline.
Fluent English and Swedish.  
* 

  

**Bonus Skills:**

* Experience working with cloud ecosystems and ISV go-to-market models (AWS, Microsoft, Google Cloud, Salesforce).
* Experience managing MDF/co-funded partner programs and tracking ROI.
* Background in payments, fintech or SME marketing.
* Proven track record organising local partner events and community programmes.
* Knowledge of GDPR and EU marketing compliance.

Even if you don’t check every box, **your unique potential and willingness to learn** could set you apart.  



**What’s in it for You** ?


* **Attractive salary and a competitive benefits package** to reward your expertise and contributions
* **Join an international team:** Collaborate with experts from across Europe and bring your ideas to life in a dynamic, global environment
* **Grow and develop:** Gain hands-on experience and structured training through our **PayTech University** , designed to accelerate your career and help you reach your full potential. In Nexi there are always plenty of opportunities.

**Discover Life at Nexi**  

We’re an international team of 10,000+ people across 25 countries, united by shared ambition and a passion for innovation. Learn more about our culture, Values, and how we’re shaping the future of digital payments. Visit our Life at Nexi page.


**Diversity and Inclusion at Nexi**  

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: together, we succeed by embracing our differences and creating a future where everyone can thrive.


**Your Next Step Starts Here**  

If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear your story. Submit your application today, and let’s shape the future of digital payments together!

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook—but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.

  

Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 41,000+ GitHub Stars.

  

At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.

  

By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.

  

At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data

### **What would you do at Prisma?**


We anticipate you to be responsible for:

* **People:** Empower your engineering team to achieve technical excellence and meaningful impact by ensuring they have the support and resources to do their best work. This includes providing constructive feedback, creating learning and growth opportunities, and challenging them to improve. Help them understand why their work matters and how it aligns with company-wide KPIs. We believe that strong, healthy teams start with investing in people.
* **Process:** Optimize and refine development processes and technical practices to drive continuous improvement. We believe in relentless optimization—if something can be done better, we find a way. You will lead engineering team meetings to plan and prioritize work, run retrospectives to identify improvements, and establish policies that enhance communication, collaboration, and code quality.
* **Delivery:** Success for your team means consistently delivering high-quality software that provides value while maintaining a sustainable pace. You will collaborate closely with the Product Manager to prioritize product initiatives, define the roadmap, and drive technical improvements.

### **An Ideal Candidate Profile**


We believe the right candidate for this position should meet a majority of the criteria listed below.

* **8+ Years proven leadership** in software engineering teams, with hands-on experience as a software engineer. Specifically a strong understanding of
* **Experience in database and backend technologies**, including TypeScript, SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, MongoDB, SQL Server), and familiarity with cloud services, APIs (GraphQL/REST), and developer tooling is a plus.
* **High standards for quality**, ensuring excellence while balancing **pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency**—taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* Focused on helping your team **understand the** ***why.***
* **Strong communication skills in English**, both written and verbal—able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, **give and receive constructive feedback effectively**, and foster collaboration across teams.
* **You have a structured thought process**, approaching problems methodically and making well-reasoned decisions. **You plan effectively**, setting clear goals, anticipating challenges, and ensuring smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.

### **What's it like to work at Prisma?**


You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...

* **... have an ownership mindset.** As an Engineering Manager leading the ORM team, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* **... stay nimble.** It's a startup, things change and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* **... be kind and collaborative.** Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.

### **What's in it for you?**


We put our people first. Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.

* An opportunity to **lead the team shaping Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products**, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications — see what we’re building.
* **A Fun and Supportive Team** that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* **Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options**, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* **Fully Remote Work** with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* **Generous Time Off**, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* **Parental Benefits**, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* **Sabbatical Leave**, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* **Mental Health Support**, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* **Tech budge** to equip you with the tools you need.
* **Annual Off-sites**, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* **Relocation Support**, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* **[US] Health and Pension Benefits**, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.

### **Remote Work**


To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone **GMT -2 to GMT +3** for this position.

### **What is our hiring process like?**

* **Introductory Call** with our Head of Engineering
* **Take Home Assignment** followed by a debrief call with members from Engineering and Leadership to discuss your assignment.
* **Team Interview** with some of the engineers that form part of your team.
* **Leadership Interview** with our COO.
* **Final Interview** \*\*with our CEO.
* **Offer**


The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.

  

If you believe that this is the right position for you then please send your resume along with any supporting documentation or information to us via the link provided on this page. We typically respond within 7 business days.


In line with our *Fair Treatment and Equal Opportunity Policy*, as well as our *Disability Policy*, Prisma follows fair and merit-based hiring practices, ensuring all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, experience, and qualifications. We do not make hiring decisions based on *age*, *race*, *ethnicity, sex, gender identity, parental or caregiver status, trade union membership, disability, religious belief or lack of belief, life expectancy, sexual orientation, genetic information*, or *veteran or military status.*

Welcome to SAS and the customer team! We are a part of SAS Commercial and responsible for analyzing marketing and customer data to better understand and predict our customers’ needs and behavior. We are now looking for a customer analyst that will be part of SAS’s analytics team and play an important role in our ambition to create a world-class customer experience.
  
  

**Challenges you will work on:**  

As a Customer Analyst, you will be part of a cross-functional team who is responsible for SAS Marketing and CRM communication. You will provide analysis of customer behaviors, insights and knowledge of customers’ response and predict future actions.
  
  

**Key responsibilities and tasks:**  

* Evaluate marketing campaigns and CRM communication to give insights and recommendations on how to maximize the effect of those.
* Perform analysis and create basis for decisions on e.g. creation of new automated campaigns and personalization measures.
* Help optimize and personalize customer communication in omni-channel to maximize customer experience.
* Define and set up customer segmentation.
* Create scripts and jobs in our data warehouse to gather data needed for target groups and perform analysis.
* Evaluate, test, build and maintain scoring models and target groups to maximize customer experience and the effect of marketing initiatives.


**To be successful, we believe you have:**  

* Master’s degree in relevant field such as Business administration, Economics or Statistics.
* Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience.
* Strong SQL skills.
* Experience working with CRM and/or Data Analytics.
* Experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud will be considered a big plus.
* Experience from working with analysis in a digital media context (e.g. with Google Analytics/BigQuery or similar platform).
* Knowledge in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).


As a person we believe that you have the ability to see the big picture, while you are accurate and can secure details. You are result-oriented, dedicated, reliable in delivery and have an ability to independently run and lead projects. Furthermore, you have very good analytical skills, are interested in handling large amounts of data and have the ability to see patterns and draw conclusions that support the commercials.
  
  

Why SAS?
  
  

At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
  
* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


Our Culture at SAS
  
At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
  
  

Additional information
  
* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: Asap
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna or Copenhagen, and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.


Come and fly with us!

title: Independent Software Vendors Marketing Manager
description:
**Shape the Future of Payments with Nexi in 2025**  

Envision a world where every transaction feels effortless, safe, and connected. At Nexi, we’re leading this transformation, building tools and solutions that redefine how the world pays. By joining us, you’ll play a part in creating the next generation of digital payments in an innovative, international environment.
  

  

**Why This Role Is Right for You**  

As an **Independent Software Vendors Partner Marketing Manager** , you’ll join a collaborative and forward-thinking team based in Sweeden. Together, we work on partnering with local Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) to co-develop and scale joint go-to-market plans that drive adoption of Nexi payment solutions among SME merchants and accelerate pipeline growth across the market.
  

  

**About Your Future Role**  

In this position, you will:


* Develop and execute joint GTM strategies and integrated partner marketing campaigns (digital advertising, content, webinars, events, social) with Independent Software Vendors partners to generate qualified leads and pipeline.
* Own the partner marketing lifecycle for your market — partner acquisition, onboarding, lead nurturing, MDF management and performance reporting.
* Create partner enablement assets (playbooks, battlecards, decks, case studies and webinars) that help Partner Sales convert faster.
* Plan and deliver local partner events and build partner communities to increase engagement and brand awareness.
* Coordinate with Product, Proposition and Central Partner teams to localise offers and feed market insights into product and proposition development.
* Continuously monitor campaign performance and optimise using data and marketing automation/CRM insights.
Manage local budgets, vendor and agency relationships to deliver campaigns on time and on budget.  
* 

**What Makes You a Great Fit**  

We’re looking for someone eager to make a difference. Here’s what we value:
  

  

**Essential Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field.
* Significant experience in B2B marketing with demonstrated partner/ Independent Software Vendors marketing experience.
* Strong hands-on experience with marketing automation and CRM tools (e.g., Marketo, HubSpot, Salesforce) and campaign analytics.
* Proven experience delivering integrated demand-generation campaigns that drive measurable pipeline.
Fluent English and Swedish.  
* 

  

**Bonus Skills:**

* Experience working with cloud ecosystems and ISV go-to-market models (AWS, Microsoft, Google Cloud, Salesforce).
* Experience managing MDF/co-funded partner programs and tracking ROI.
* Background in payments, fintech or SME marketing.
* Proven track record organising local partner events and community programmes.
* Knowledge of GDPR and EU marketing compliance.

Even if you don’t check every box, **your unique potential and willingness to learn** could set you apart.  



**What’s in it for You** ?


* **Attractive salary and a competitive benefits package** to reward your expertise and contributions
* **Join an international team:** Collaborate with experts from across Europe and bring your ideas to life in a dynamic, global environment
* **Grow and develop:** Gain hands-on experience and structured training through our **PayTech University** , designed to accelerate your career and help you reach your full potential. In Nexi there are always plenty of opportunities.

**Discover Life at Nexi**  

We’re an international team of 10,000+ people across 25 countries, united by shared ambition and a passion for innovation. Learn more about our culture, Values, and how we’re shaping the future of digital payments. Visit our Life at Nexi page.


**Diversity and Inclusion at Nexi**  

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: together, we succeed by embracing our differences and creating a future where everyone can thrive.


**Your Next Step Starts Here**  

If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear your story. Submit your application today, and let’s shape the future of digital payments together!

title: Tekniker inom Virtualiseringsteknik
description:
**Om jobbet**
-------------


Som en del av virtualiseringsteamet är det du som utvecklar, underhåller och driftar våra virtualiseringsplattformar samt hjälper vår verksamhet med deras behov.


Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

* Förvalta och utveckla virtualiseringsplattformar.
* Samarbeta nära andra team och verksamheten för att lösa tekniska utmaningar.
* Bidra med kreativa lösningar och driva innovation i en komplex IT-miljö.


Du kommer jobba med moderna virtualiseringsmiljöer som VMware och HyperV i en komplex och samhällskritisk IT-miljö. Vi arbetar agilt och nära verksamheten, där du får möjlighet att påverka lösningar och arbeta med ny teknik som t.ex. VMware Cloud Foundation och Aria Suite. Du får också möjlighet att vidareutvecklas - både genom dagligt arbete och kompetenshöjande insatser.


Virtualiseringsteamet arbetar enligt agila metodiker och teamet består idag av åtta personer där vi hjälper varandra och har roligt ihop på jobbet.

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Du har många kontaktytor och bemöter andra uppmärksamt och tillmötesgående. Du kommunicerar tydligt och anpassat till mottagaren, enskilt och i grupp. Med god problemlösningsförmåga levererar du kvalitetssäkrade lösningar i en komplex miljö. Du är engagerad, tar ansvar och driver ditt arbete strukturerat mot deadline.


Vi söker dig som har

* minst godkänd gymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kunskaper/utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som av oss bedöms likvärdig
* några års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av virtualiseringsplattformar Vmware och/eller HyperV, gärna i Enterprisemiljö
* kunskap i scriptning
* goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har

* kunskaper om VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF)
* kunskaper om VMware Aria Suite
* kunskaper om NSX
* arbetslivserfarenhet av agila arbetssätt.
**Övrig information**
---------------------


Beredskap kan ingå i tjänsten.


Placeringsort för tjänsten är Borlänge, Gävle. Önskar du att arbeta delvis på distans? I den här tjänsten finns det möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till 40 procent av din arbetstid.


Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen, som genomförs i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).

**Ansökan**
-----------


I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet. Intervjuer sker initialt via Skype och planeras till v. 47-48.


De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget. I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet.


Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss!


Inom vår IT-organisation är du med och utvecklar Sverige med hjälp av moderna och innovativa lösningar. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändring där vi försöker ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter till fullo. Digitaliseringen ställer allt större krav och vi vill därför anpassa oss vad gäller kompetens, arbetssätt och organisation i takt med utvecklingen. Vi har ett helhetsansvar för IT och telekom, en verksamhet som pågår dygnet runt, året om - precis som Sveriges transportsystem.


På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.


#LI-Hybrid


#LI-BS1
company_description: Trafikverket ansvarar för långsiktig planering av transportsystemet för vägtrafik, järnvägstrafik, sjöfart och luftfart.

title: Chief Architect
description:
**Join Our Team as a Chief Architect at Simployer!**



At Simployer, we’re shaping the future of HR technology. Our goal is simple but ambitious: to make it easier to be a great employer. As our products evolve, architecture becomes a critical enabler for innovation, scale and reliability. That’s why we’re now looking for a **Chief Architect,** a hands-on leader who can define, align and drive our architectural direction across products, platforms and teams.



This role blends strategic oversight with practical guidance: you’ll set target architectures, but also work side by side with engineers to make solutions real. If you’re passionate about turning complex technical landscapes into cohesive, scalable systems — and about helping people succeed in practice — this could be the opportunity for you.



**What We Offer**


* **Collaborative Culture** – Join a supportive, dynamic team dedicated to learning and growth.
* **Professional Development** – Access opportunities to expand your skills and grow within the organization.
* **Competitive Compensation** – Enjoy a market-aligned salary and benefits package.
* **Real Impact** – Make a significant impact on our products, clients, and business.


**About the Role**



As **Chief Architect**, you’ll play a central role in shaping how Simployer’s suite of applications and platforms evolves. You will define our target architecture and guide the journey towards it, ensuring decisions are pragmatic, scalable and aligned with business goals. You’ll lead our architecture chapter, mentor teams, and partner closely with product, engineering and operations leadership. From information and data modelling to platform conventions, you’ll help us build systems that scale, integrate smoothly and enable innovation — including the effective use of AI across our products. This is architecture with impact: theory turned into practice, decisions translated into real-world solutions.


  
Skills & Requirements


**What You Will Do:**


* Define and align our target architecture across multiple applications and modules.
* Lead the architecture chapter, establishing and governing standards, principles and practices.
* Collaborate with senior leadership and teams to ensure architecture supports business goals and go-to-market needs.
* Develop development principles and standards for application, technical and infrastructure/security architecture.
* Conduct architectural reviews and support teams with practical application design.
* Stay ahead of industry trends and bring in innovative practices — including AI.
* Document and communicate architectural decisions clearly across the organisation.

**We think You’ll Thrive in This Role if You Have:**

* 10+ years’ experience in software architecture and/or engineering.
* Strong background in solution architecture, with hands-on experience (hopefully) across multiple platforms.
* Solid experience in information and data modelling (domain-driven design, bounded contexts).
* Ability to translate theoretical architecture into actionable, technical solutions.
* Experience with modern cloud, distributed systems, and security/compliance standards.
* Excellent collaboration skills — you enjoy working with people, aligning teams and “bringing them along.”
* Curiosity for how to leverage AI and how it can shape architecture.


**Message from the Hiring Manager:**

*Hi, I'm Peder, CTO for Simployer Group, and I'll be your manager if you join us as Chief Architect. Simployer is on an exciting growth journey, investing heavily into our products and technology platforms backed by strong owners and a profitable business, and I'm really excited to strengthen our architecture capability with this role reporting directly to me, working with several exceptional individuals in Product & Tech. As a leader, I value autonomy and empowerment as I believe individuals thrive when they are given the freedom to drive and deliver things with as little impediment as possible - but I am always available for coaching and support whenever you need it. I am keen that we in Tech help drive things forward and deliver results that matter, aligned with and enabling our product and commercial strategies. If this sounds like your kind of challenge, I’d love to hear from you.*



**Why Join Simployer?**



By joining Simployer, you’ll be part of a dynamic, inclusive, and innovative workplace. You’ll have access to unlimited resources and extensive industry experience while working with a variety of exciting products. We’re building something big — join us and be part of a culture that values your growth and success. Together, we’ll change the HR tech game!


**Our Hiring Process:**


* **Intro Chat:** A quick conversation with our recruiter to get to know you and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).
* **Logic test and Personality test (Alva Labs)** – Discover how you’ll fit with our team.
* **Meet & Greet:** Meet with your future manager to dive deeper into your experience and discuss the role (approx. 1 hour)
* **Case interview:** Show us your skills through real-world problem-solving. (approx. 1 hour)
* **Team Chat:** Let’s talk culture, values, and your future with us. A casual chat to wrap things up, answer any last questions, and make sure we’re a perfect match (approx. 30 minutes).



We can’t wait to meet you!



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


  
Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values****Learn, Lead and Deliver**With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.

title: Cyber Security Specialist, Lund
description:
**About Justera Group**  

Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.

##### **About the Role:**


We are seeking a highly skilled Cyber Security Specialist to join our CyberSOC team. In this role, you will help strengthen our cybersecurity posture by managing and enhancing our SIEM platform, addressing incidents from detection to resolution, and ensuring compliance with regulatory and business requirements. This position offers the opportunity to take ownership of critical security tools, work closely with development teams, and make a significant impact on the protection of enterprise systems across a global environment.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Manage and operate the SIEM platform, including onboarding datasets, automation, and incident response.
* Investigate and resolve cybersecurity incidents across infrastructure, networks, operating systems, and cloud environments.
* Translate internal and external threats into actionable risks and ensure timely mitigation.
* Collaborate with development and operations teams to integrate security tools and processes effectively.
* Deliver clear, concise reports highlighting trends, risks, and security gaps.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and business security requirements.
* 

**Requirements:**

  

**Experience & Skills:**

* Minimum 5 years of experience in cybersecurity with expertise in Cyber Threat Management.
* Proven hands-on experience with SIEM platforms (onboarding, automation, incident response).
* Broad technical knowledge across infrastructure, networks, operating systems (Windows, Linux), and cloud (Azure).
* Strong background in incident response, threat detection, and risk-based security practices.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and collaboration with development teams.
* Knowledge of Zero Trust principles (preferred).

**Key Competencies:**

* SIEM Tools: CrowdStrike, Cribl Edge & Stream, Splunk Core/Enterprise Security.
* Endpoint Tools: CrowdStrike, Palo Alto Cortex XDR, Cylance Protect.
* Cloud Security: Azure Sentinel.
* Security Architecture & Design for SIEM environments.

**Mandatory Skills (at least 3):**

* Security Tools: CrowdStrike, Cribl, Splunk, Cylance, Palo Alto XDR.
* Platforms: Windows, Linux.
* Cloud: Azure.


**Desired Skills (at least 2):**


Programming/Scripting: SPL, XQL, PowerShell, JSON.


**What We Offer:**

  

* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Engineering Manager med fokus på Cloud-resa till GCP
description:
### **OM JOBBET**


Vi söker en erfaren Engineering Manager till vår kunds plattforms- och driftteam!  

Uppdraget passar dig som har en stark teknisk förståelse, vana att driva leveranser och en naturlig förmåga att skapa energi och framdrift i team.

* Omfattning: Heltid
* Start: ASAP
* Längd: T.o.m. juni 2026
* Plats: Stockholm (hybrid – 2–3 dagar/vecka på plats)

#### **ARBETSUPPGIFTER**


Rollen innebär både operativt och strategiskt ansvar – från att säkerställa leverans och teamets effektivitet till att bidra till ett modernt, datadrivet arbetssätt inom plattform och drift. Ett viktig initiativ är kundens molnresan från on-prem till Google Cloud Platform (GCP) så erfarenhet av cloud är ett stort plus.


### **ERFARENHETER OCH EGENSKAPER**

* Erfarenhet som Engineering Manager eller liknande ledarroll med leveransansvar
* Bakgrund från techbolag, gärna inom plattform- eller driftutveckling (exempelvis, Spotify, Klarna eller liknande)
* God förståelse för molnteknologier – erfarenhet av GCP eller annan större cloudplattform är ett stort plus
* Förmåga att driva förändringsarbete och leverans i komplexa miljöer
* Erfarenhet av datadrivet arbetssätt och kontinuerlig förbättring
* Positiv energi, engagemang och driv – du får saker att hända!

### **TID FÖR ANSÖKAN**


Låter detta som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi intervjuar löpande!


### **OM D-SOURCE**

*Your source to IT*  

D-Source är ett modernt konsultbolag med bredden mellan helpdesk, infrastruktur och Tech. Vi har lång erfarenhet av att förstå kunders IT-behov! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du är intresserad av att ta reda på mer.


Vad kan vi göra för dig och vad kan vi göra tillsammans?  



  

### **INGET JOBB FÖR DIG?**


Lugnt! Du kan alltid registrera dig förutsättningslöst på D-Source jobbsida genom att Connecta med oss. Då hamnar du i vår kandidatdatabas och får koll på våra kommande aktuella tjänster.

title: Tech Leader
description:
**At OMATEQ we specialize in providing highly skilled technology professionals to mid-sized companies with proprietary software.** Our clients trust us because we not only master software development but also bring leadership and product expertise grounded in deep technical understanding. Whether stepping in as a software developer, engineering manager, or interim CTO, we combine technical excellence with business awareness to set both long-term strategy as well as create immediate impact. With an average of 10 years of experience, we bring depth, reliability, and problem-solving ability to every engagement.We are now looking for a **Technology Leader** to strengthen our team of experienced professionals. At OMATEQ, you’ll work in challenging and dynamic environments where your expertise meets innovation head-on. You’ll help our clients drive technology strategy, scale engineering organizations, and deliver impactful software – taking on roles such as **Engineering Manager, Product Manager, or interim CTO** depending on the client’s needs.

  

Who Are You?

  

* 7+ years of professional experience with a strong background in software development.
* Previous **people leadership experience** – you have managed teams and/or coached engineers with a formal personnel responsibility.
* Ability to move seamlessly between roles – from **hands-on technology leadership** to **strategic product and organizational management**.
* Solid experience in modern software engineering practices, cloud-native development, and scaling technical platforms.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills – able to bridge technology and business.
* Curious, pragmatic, and **prestigeless** – you see opportunities in both interim CTO assignments as well as impactful manager or product roles.
* A friendly mindset and a desire to be in an environment where what matters is how you treat people and what you deliver.
* Fluency in Swedish, both spoken and written.


The Environment

  

* Be part of a consulting company with a strong reputation for **craftsmanship and long-term expertise**.
* Collaborate with **senior colleagues** who share your interest in business development with technology as the main driver.
* Opportunity to **shape how we work** and influence the growth of OMATEQ’s tech management offering.
* Work on meaningful, cutting-edge projects in a variety of industries.
* Hybrid work model with flexibility and a purpose-driven culture.
* **Generous compensation** and full ownership of your professional journey.

title: SCRUM MASTER
description:
**Scrum Master**
 Are you someone who thrives on agility and enjoys enabling teams to do their best work? Do you have a talent for removing obstacles, fostering collaboration, and guiding teams toward continuous improvement? If so, our Scrum Master role might be the perfect fit for you!
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 In this exciting and dynamic role, you will serve as a key enabler of agile excellence across teams and domains. You will tackle the intricate task of fostering a high-performing, self-organizing team culture while ensuring alignment with agile delivery standards and frameworks. As the main point of contact for agile facilitation, you will coordinate with product owners, agile leads, and stakeholders to drive continuous improvement and delivery success.
   

  

 Your ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders will be crucial as you:
   

  

* Guide and coach agile teams on Scrum practices, roles, and ceremonies.
* Facilitate sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, and reviews.
* Remove impediments and nurture a culture of ownership and accountability.
* Ensure team alignment with agile delivery standards and frameworks.
* Support the Agile & AD Practices Lead in scaling agile practices across teams and domains.
* Collaborate with product owners to maintain well-defined backlogs and prioritization.
* Track and report team performance metrics to support data-driven improvements.
* Promote transparency, collaboration, and an agile mindset across the organization.
* Ensure agile delivery processes are followed and continuously refined.
* Act as a servant leader and coach to one or more agile teams.
* Support alignment between team-level execution and enterprise-level goals.
* Contribute actively to the agile community of practice within SAS.


**The Team**
 As part of our newly created Office of the CIO in Digital & IT, you will be part of a high-performing and diverse team composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds. Our team values collaboration, innovation, and a commitment to excellence. We support each other and thrive on creating a positive and inclusive work environment where everyone can succeed. You’ll work closely with product owners, developers, and other scrum masters, collaborating with the Agile & AD Practices Lead and transformation teams to align practices. Everyone in the team will contribute to the agile community of practice within SAS communicating effectively to drive agile practices across the organization.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Strong facilitation and coaching skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Proactive problem-solving and conflict resolution skills.
* Deep understanding of agile principles and servant leadership.
* Ability to foster team collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Experience working in SAFe or other scaled agile environments.
* Familiarity with agile tools (e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps).
* University degree in IT, Business, or related field.
* Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) or equivalent certification preferred.
* 3+ years of experience as a Scrum Master or in agile delivery roles.
* Commitment to work from the office 3 days per week.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 23/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: 01/12/2025
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**

title: HEAD OF AGILE & AD PRACTICES
description:
**Head of Agile & Application Development Practices**
 Are you someone who thrives on driving transformation and enabling teams to deliver high-quality digital solutions? Do you have a passion for agile ways of working and a strategic mindset for modern application development? If so, our Head of Agile & Application Development Practices role might be the perfect fit for you!
   

  

 As Head of Agile & AD Practices, you will lead the transformation of SAS’s agile ways of working by embedding a unified, business-integrated agile operating model across Digital & IT and the wider SAS organisation, while also driving the evolution of application development practices to enable scalable, high-quality software delivery.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 In this exciting and dynamic role, you will oversee the transformation of SAS’s agile ways of working and application development practices.
   

  

 You will tackle the intricate task of designing and implementing a mature agile setup anchored in agile frameworks, while modernizing engineering capabilities across teams. As the main point of contact for agile enablement and development excellence, you will coordinate with Digital & IT, SAS business units, and external partners to embed agile principles, roles, and ceremonies into cross-functional teams. Your ability to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders will be crucial in driving agile adoption, uplifting technical capabilities, and aligning delivery with strategic goals.
   

  

**Your Ability To Collaborate Will Be Crucial As You**
* Lead and coach a team of agile professionals (coaches and scrum masters) to support agile adoption across business and IT.
* Define and implement agile metrics, governance models, and continuous improvement practices.
* Facilitate agile training, onboarding, and capability uplift across SAS and its partners.
* Act as a change agent to foster a culture of collaboration, transparency, and adaptive delivery.
* Lead the transformation of application development practices, including the adoption of modern engineering principles such as CI/CD, DevOps, automated testing, and cloud-native development.
* Collaborate with software engineering teams to align agile delivery with technical excellence and scalable architecture.
* Ensure integration of agile ways of working with robust application development lifecycles and tooling.


**The Team**
 As the Head of Agile & AD Practices within our newly created Office of the CIO in Digital & IT, you will play a pivotal leadership role in shaping how SAS delivers value through agile ways of working and modern engineering practices. You will be part of a high-performing and diverse team composed of talented professionals from various backgrounds, united by a shared commitment to collaboration, innovation, and excellence.
   

  

 In this role, you will lead the alignment of agile and application development practices across SAS, working closely with product owners, developers, scrum masters, and transformation teams. You will set the direction for how agile principles and engineering standards are embedded into cross-functional teams, ensuring consistency, scalability, and continuous improvement. As a key driver of SAS’s agile community of practice, you will foster a culture of transparency, learning, and delivery excellence—communicating effectively across the organization to champion agile and technical maturity.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Deep understanding of agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and scaling agile in large organisations.
* Strong leadership, coaching, and facilitation skills.
* Ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
* Strategic thinking with hands-on delivery mindset.
* Excellent communication and change management capabilities.
* Strong grasp of software development lifecycle, engineering principles, and agile technical practices.
* 7+ years of experience in agile roles, including 5+ years leading enterprise-level agile transformations.
* Proven track record implementing SAFe or similar frameworks in complex, multi-stakeholder environments.
* Experience working with both in-house and offshore delivery models.
* Demonstrated experience leading large-scale application development transformations, including modernizing engineering practices and delivery pipelines.
* University degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* SAFe Program Consultant (SPC) certification or equivalent is a strong plus.
* Commitment to work from the office 3 days per week.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 22/10/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: 01/12/25
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.


**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
**Opportunity for Hands on CTO at VC backed startup - Stockholm** 




  





 My client, a (significantly) seed-funded AI startup based in Stockholm, are looking for a CTO to build their AI industry insights platform. They have recently undergone a successful proof of concept with one of Europe's largest fintechs, and are looking for a CTO to bring their MVP to a production ready product.
 



  





 In this role, you will determine the technical decisions that define how the product is built. This includes everything, from building the founding engineering team from day 1, to defining the architecture of the product and building out the product according to your idea, all whilst being given technical ownership of the product. Significant equity + competitive salary are offered too!!
 



**Requirements** 




  




* 5+ years of tech leadership experience
* Experience leading customer facing teams and projects at strong tech companies in Sweden, or experience leading projects in startups and scaleups.
* Solid experience leading projects involved with the development of LLMs.
* Recent hands on experience in developing AI products with a similar techstack: Typescript, React, Next, FastAPI, Open AI, RAG, Audio AI



  





 If you're interested, please apply to this ad :). Reviews are continuous, review time should be no more than 48 hours

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**What will you be doing?**
*The bridge between Cloud and R&D activities.*
 Our cloud-focused team is growing! Today, we are a team of about 8 people focusing on cloud solutions, primarily Azure and AWS. The team consists of a mix of experienced specialists and architects, as well as driven developers. You will be based in Stockholm, Kista, but team members are also located in other parts of the country. You will influence how we develop our cloud business going forward.
   

  

 Remote work generally works well for this type of role, which is why we also hire people from other parts of Sweden.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You are passionate about and have experience in:
   

  

* Minimum 3-4 years of experience of working with cloud
* Need to have experience with cloud from a couple of projects, primarily Azure
* Need to be certified in Azure, at least admin associate
* Need to have experience in both cloud architecture and hands-on cloud intrastructure implementation


 You also have:
   

  

* Excellent communication skills
* fluent in Swedish, both verbal and written
* An interest in working both holistically and hands-on


 We value personal qualities, communicative skills and social competence.
   

  

 This gives us flexible teams and a great company culture where we all work well together and feel the support from our peer.
   

  

**About Us**
 Knowit offers a chance to achieve professional goals through challenging tasks and positive leadership. Working with customers at Knowit Connectivity provides opportunities to develop skills while enjoying the job. The workplace is fast-paced, fun, and inspiring with a great team spirit that works towards making a difference for the company and customers. There are many chances for personal development through innovative projects and skill development models. Knowit's corporate culture values sustainability and is built on consensus, openness, honesty, and respect for individual value and dignity. Knowit Connectivity specializes in exciting areas such as self-driving cars, infotainment systems, and 5G development, with expertise in embedded, cloud, and application domains.
   

  

**Application**
 We have an ongoing selection of application, so please apply for the position as soon as possible!

title: AI Product Manager
description:
**Title** 
 - AI Product Manager
 



**Location** 
 - Stockholm (Flexible Hybrid Model)
 



  





**Due to the urgency of these requirements, our client is only accepting applications from applicants who have the right to work and live in Europe.** 




  





**About the Role** 




 Our client who are an AI start up based in Stockholm are looking for an experienced
 **AI Product Manager** 
 to lead the development and implementation of cutting-edge AI products, with a particular focus on
 **Large Language Models (LLMs)** 
 and intelligent automation. You’ll work closely with engineering, data science, and design teams to define the roadmap, align technical strategy with business goals, and ensure the successful delivery of innovative AI-powered solutions
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Own the
 **product vision and roadmap** 
 for AI/LLM-based features and platforms.
* Collaborate with
 **engineering, data science, and design teams** 
 to turn complex ideas into scalable, high-impact products.
* Translate user and business needs into detailed
 **requirements and specifications** 
 .
* Manage the
 **end-to-end product lifecycle** 
 , from concept and prioritisation to launch and iteration.
* Evaluate and select AI models (including open-source and proprietary LLMs) and ensure ethical, secure, and responsible AI use.
* Lead
 **sprint planning, backlog prioritisation, and delivery tracking** 
 for the AI development teams.



  





**Requirements** 



* **3+ years** 
 of experience as a Product Manager in software or AI-driven environments.
* Strong background working with
 **AI/ML technologies** 
 , including LLMs, NLP, and generative AI systems.
* Proven track record
 **leading or collaborating with software development teams** 
 .
* Technical understanding of model APIs, vector databases, and cloud deployment (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
* Experience with
 **Agile development** 
 , backlog management, and cross-functional collaboration.
* Excellent communication skills in
 **English** 
 (Swedish is a plus).



  





**What They Offer** 



* Opportunity to shape the future of AI innovation within a fast-scaling product company.
* Collaborative and forward-thinking work environment with strong technical culture.
* Hybrid setup — modern office in central Stockholm with flexible remote days.
